item.title: Food bins not empties, 20th June
item.description:
Daneby Rd food bins not emptied this week. I'm the heat we will have maggots crawling in them however careful we are. This is the 2nd time in recent weeks they have not been emptied
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daneby Road, Catford South, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping - many bags of rubbish along road, 20th June
item.description:
Flytipping - many bags of rubbish all along the road - about 20 - looks like garden waste, food waste, and other rubbish. A fridge and a mini snooker table. One of the bags has been ripped open and it is mixed rubbish with food waste. Please could it be removed/cleared. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eltham Hill, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped rubbish all over street, 20th June
item.description:
Someone flytipped 6-7 bin bags of household waste outside our door, itâ€™s now been rummaged through and now looks like this. Please help resolve, it stinks.

item.title: 2 meter square wood/card package left outside no. 29 Ashburnham Grove, SE10 8UL, 20th June
item.description:
This 2 meter square wood/card package has been left outside no. 29 Ashburnham Grove for 5 days and is partially blocking the narrow pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Ashburnham Grove, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parked at the entrance of the park, 20th June
item.description:
Can you enforce some parking attendants to come down Norfolk Close? One car treats the entrance of the car park as their parking spot, and leaves their car parked there all day (06:30-17:30). This causes two things: 1. The Council's parks workers can't drive through the entrance to do their job. 2. Every car van and lorry that drives down Norfolk Close, ends up almost hitting the cars on my drive because there in nowhere to turn. 3. Wheelchair users and pedestrians find it difficult to access the park because there's not enough space to enter the park!. We would prefer the park gates are constantly locked but that gas been tried to no avail. Please issue a ticket or something, so that this driver stops parking at the entrance of the park and prevent a new parking trend from happening. Thank you. PS What are you doing about the abandoned car at the top if this road, previously reported 2/3 times?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Norfolk Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very narrow road and difficult to park car at 44 Firs lane due to card parking opposite the house, 20th June
item.description:
Three cars usually park opposite 44 Firs lane. This makes it very congested on the road and difficult to park inside 44 Firs lane. Backing the car out is also extremely difficult. Ideally this area opposite the house should be empty and have a sign of no parking.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Firs Avenue, Friern Barnet, London

item.title: Harvist Road/Queens Park, 20th June
item.description:
